title: Under some circumstances rt requires pthread; cmake does not handle this case correctly
body_html:
Here, I have a gcc-5-glibc-2.23 toolchain, which requires -pthread to compile the following simple program:

$ cat test.c
#include <sys/mman.h>
#include <fcntl.h>
int main() {
  shm_open("/dev/shm", 0, O_RDONLY);
  return 0;
}
$ gcc.par -lrt test.c
[redacted]/lib64/librt.so: undefined reference to `__pthread_barrier_wait@GLIBC_PRIVATE'
[redacted]/lib64/librt.so: undefined reference to `__pthread_barrier_init@GLIBC_PRIVATE'
/lib64/libpthread.so.0: undefined reference to `h_errno@GLIBC_PRIVATE'
[redacted]/lib64/librt.so: undefined reference to `__shm_directory@GLIBC_PRIVATE'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
$ gcc.par -pthread -lrt test.c
$

The cmake doesn't handle this case correctly, and so I get a build error when trying to build libshm.
